page.title: 08THE WORK OF A LOCAL BUILDER
page.content: We asked a local builder about his work.he has been building for 32 years .He builds houses on ex-farm land and enjoys what he does,sometimes it is hard to get building permission. He starts work at 8am. and finishes in the summer at 5.30pm. In the winter he may finish earlier if the weather is bad. He is{self employed}and has a certain amount of land to build on. He uses laminates, wood, concrete and plastic as well as brick. The{bricks come from the London brick company and are Fletton, Ibstock and thermolite blocks. Ladders, carpentry tools, power drills and scaffolding are part of his{equipment.}He likes the houses built at present. In Thorpe End the new houses blend in with the others. Sometimes{conservationists}affect his work. He thinks there will be more building in the area in the future.
